betterquesting:10.desc:8:
You have probably already seen button called §6Optimize Patterns§r when making an order in your AE system, now it's time to put it in the good use!

To unlock this feature, just add §bPattern Optimization Matrix§r block to your AE system (you only need one).

§l# What does it do?
§r
This feature allows you to §nmass multiply patterns§r that need it.

1. After calculating a big order, just click §6Optimize Patterns§r and you will be welcomed by a new window.
2. There you specify how much you wish for a singular pattern to be ordered (§nmaximum amount of steps§r), we recommend putting it at 1000 or 100, [warn]remeber that overoptimizing patterns could lead to longer waiting times[/warn]. At this point, you can also disable singular patterns from optimization by clicking on them, but there shouldn't be any unwanted patterns anyway if you already excluded them by toggling a button in unwanted interfaces.
§7§o
If you are still confused from maximum order steps here's an example:
Ordering EOH calculated that it will need 1,000,008 UHV superconductors crafted (41667 steps, 24 UHV SC patterned), now you proceed to optimize patterns and specify that you wish it to do 1000 steps maximum, it will multiply your pattern 64 times to achieve that goal (41667 / 64 ~= 652 which is lower or equal to 1000). After clicking optimize, UHV SC pattern will now output 1536 UHV SC (24 before).

§r3. Click §6Optimize§r and you are done! Try ordering again to see the changes in pattern steps

All changes are [warn]permament and can't be reverted automatically[/warn] so make sure that you have excluded all unwanted interfaces (§dAllow Pattern Optimization§r button is §7GRAY§r) like:
- Single Assembly Line interfaces
- Extreme Crafting interfaces
- And any interfaces that doesn't have (almost)infinite buffer at the other side (inf. chest/storage cells)
Patterns are multiplied by the powers of 2 so your (U)AAL patterns should be safe
